posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked:
The text is:  
**EasyMobile Version 1.32 (End-of-Life on May 6, 2025):**  
The **public version of Quick Attendance** will officially reach its **End-of-Life** on **May 6, 2025**, at **10:00 am ET**.  

It was initially released on **February 25, 2025**, with a focus on **End-of-Life Testing**. Beta testing began on **January 25, 2025**, and a total of **100 user alpha testing teams** were involved.  

Quick Attendance is designed for **FRC teams** to streamline **Attendance Tracking**. The system works by generating a unique QR code on the admin’s screen that resets every 11 seconds. Students scan the QR code using their phones to mark attendance.  

Key features include:
- Fast & Clean interface
- Dynamic QR code generation
- Immediate result logging
- Attendance Reset capabilities
- Team Manager permissions
- Custom Security settings
- Multiple language options
- CSV File import/export functionality
- Student roles & permissions
- Parent team admin permissions
- MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication)
- Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) is highly recommended
- Server time management
- FRT (Frontal control)
- TC (Timer till End of Life)

Bug fixes and improvements:
- Fixed issues with limited user availability and server-based permissions
- Resolved problems with user roles and permissions
- Improved two-factor authentication
- Enhanced team manager capabilities
- Streamlined parent team admin permissions
- Fixed student account creation issues
- Improved password complexity requirements
- Replaced TFU (Time-to-Update) model with more effective algorithms
- Added system management using standard encryption
- Improved data protection
- Optimized performance
- Reduced server load

Features coming soon:
- Limited team admin group
- Parent user group
- School user group
- Turkish user registration based on FC robots
- Full Turkish translation
- UI rework
- Assign multiple teams to one team admin
- Region-based data centers (Dallas, TX, USA currently active)
- Student self-password resetting

Note:
- All personal info kept private except email, name, surname, username/password, cookie, and IP address
- Region selector doesn't work until feature 8 is added
- Known bugs include invalid QR warnings and password reset limits
- Upcoming features include team admin groups, parental, school viewing, and Turkish translations

posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked: To comply with age restrictions and Data Protection Laws, children under 13 and California teams are not allowed to register. Wondering which laws, or software features, prevent California teams from registering?

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: We are sorry for the inconvenience. The restriction on registration isn't due to the law itself but because we aren't aware of California's data protection laws, such as the CCPA and CPRA (e.g., "Do not sell my data" requirements). We avoid potential legal issues due to unintentional non-compliance. We understand our expertise in GDPR and KVKK in the EU and Türkiye, but we lack knowledge of California's specific regulations. We greatly appreciate your understanding and apologize for the limited support we can provide at this time.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: New features added: If more than 1 student didn’t sign out by themselves using the QR, now instead of using Record Manual Attendance, team admins can record sign out attendance for all students at once with a single button click.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: Dark mode has been added to the team admin dashboard. An inventory management feature is upcoming in the next major version of the system. Users may face downtime during development, but an exact timeline isn’t available yet. This feature is integrated into the attendance system to improve efficiency for the team and potentially for all users of Quick Attendance. Support is available between 10 AM and 10 PM GMT+3.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: We planned to open-source the project several versions ago, but the current version requires distribution across multiple servers. We aim to create a version that runs on a single server and its associated database. Currently, user data, system configurations, and attendance records are spread across various databases. While we can't commit to an immediate release, if sufficient time is allocated, we may consider making it available as a standalone version.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked:
End-of-Life (EOL) Notice for Quick Attendance

Currently registered teams may continue using the system and receive new updates if they wish. Please send me a direct message if you would like to keep your account active.

We want to inform you that the public version of Quick Attendance will officially reach its End-of-Life (EOL) on May 6, 2025.

After thorough evaluation, we have made the difficult decision to sunset the public platform due to the following reasons:
- Zero active external users
- High costs of maintaining multiple servers for no active external users
- Technical complexity in scaling the platform to accommodate multiple teams

As a result, we will be continuing to operate and develop Quick Attendance solely for internal use by our team as it is no longer sustainable on a public scale.

Starting May 6, 2025, public access to our website will be region-blocked.
Data Deletion: All trial account user data will be permanently deleted in 3 days.
Open Source Release: The beta-1 version source code (as shown in our initial post screenshots) will be shared publicly soon.

We’re proud of what we created and thankful to everyone who explored or tested the platform.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us directly here or at support@quickattendance.com.

Sincerely
